data.text:
Nearly 826 million students affected by #COVID19 lack access to computers, mobile service or have no internet at home.

@UNESCO & partners are developing solutions for universal access to address connectivity challenges. https://t.co/VRXB764bt8 https://t.co/N93C4JTNqQ

Wildlife crime significantly impacts national security, economic development & increases the risk of zoonotic diseases, such as #COVID19.

@UNODC works to end wild animal trafficking and help reduce the likelihood of future disease outbreaks. https://t.co/Rya4OD0cJC https://t.co/rwdzubgT7V

Yemen: Funding shortages & possible closure of health facilities puts thousands of women at life-threatening risk amid #COVID19.

@UNFPA chief @Atayeshe calls for urgent funding to support health workers and protect women & girls in need. https://t.co/7aXxEPqA3S https://t.co/96cFtYCuYs

Many children need extra support to cope with the changes brought on by #COVID19.

A new storybook aims to help children adapt to a new & rapidly changing reality due to #coronavirus. 

https://t.co/BBDyRPu8h7

During #COVID19, violence against women is escalating - both at home and online.  

@UN_Women has strategies on how to prevent & respond to online gender-based violence during the pandemic. https://t.co/pU8EV3Anfh https://t.co/BwPefi1twu

Millions of internally displaced people live in crowded, unsanitary conditions with poor access to health services.

@UNMigration is supporting #COVID19 preparedness & response measures to prevent the spread of #coronavirus in displacement camps. https://t.co/GwKAO2Xx7d https://t.co/8tRzh0Acg2
This #MothersDay, @UNICEF is honouring all women giving birth amid the #COVID19 pandemic -- and calling for urgent action to support them and their babies during the crisis. https://t.co/ER9SPXC6Kw

The UN is working to counter dangerous misinformation, and ensure people have the facts they need to stay healthy in the face of the #COVID19 pandemic.

https://t.co/RehjzxpA48

Sudan has criminalized female genital mutilation, making it punishable by jail - a new era for girls' rights in the country and a step closer to an equal world for all. https://t.co/NLjdQEuBKf #EndFGM

Solidarity in Peru: @UNVolunteers & @PNUDperu moblize local youth to help vulnerable people - including senior citizens - during the #COVID19 crisis.

https://t.co/mfKCvyln3Z

Millions of mothers around the world will begin their journey into parenthood amid the #COVID19 pandemic.

This #MothersDay, @UNICEF is calling for immediate action to support new mums and their babies through the crisis.

https://t.co/zVBJkCqBHg

For 75 years, the UN has brought countries, communities and people together to face global challenges - and is now at the forefront of the fight against #COVID19.

More on #UN75: https://t.co/xZylMfLi8z https://t.co/R4N7jXqHCn

.@UNAIDS urges countries to remain committed to HIV prevention efforts during #COVID19 & ensure people have continued access to vital treatment & prevention services.

https://t.co/AYR1giqmv2

Nurses
doctors
sanitation workers
journalists
truck drivers
grocery store workers
researchers
& all essential workers

are risking their well-being to serve their communities.

We thank them for being on the front lines during the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/lIP96I0hg4

The #COVID19 pandemic comes with particular challenges for the most vulnerable, including people with disabilities.

@WHO shares tips on how to ensure everyone receives the care they need during the #coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/ADPlKY1Bp1 https://t.co/UJrcfS8q0V

Migratory birds depend on sites along their migration routes for breeding, feeding, resting & overwintering.

Help protect them on Saturday's #WorldMigratoryBirdDay and every day.

https://t.co/5jadF4bXmR https://t.co/D6EcLS29Wn

#MentalHealthMonth: @UNOCHA explores ways to address the strain #COVID19 is having on the mental well-being of some of the world's most vulnerable people -- many already grappling with war, hunger, poverty & natural disasters. 

https://t.co/VvrU5tRiLK

Migratory birds connect our world.

Even while staying at home you can show your support for Saturday's #WorldMigratoryBirdDay by making your garden bird-friendly, learning more about birds & joining bird conservation orgs.

More ideas here: https://t.co/OLKYdSyNQT https://t.co/9jRKyosLwo

As #COVID19 stretches health systems, UN support for routine - yet vital - health services is more critical than ever. Here's how we're helping.

https://t.co/Duc4NteAxU

Migratory birds connect people, ecosystems and nations.

Help protect them on Saturday's #WorldMigratoryBirdDay and every day.

https://t.co/5jadF4bXmR https://t.co/2FDlkeVmAE

“At a time of remembrance and reconciliation, we pay tribute to the millions of people who lost their lives in #WWII, and remember their sacrifices.”

-- @antonioguterres on #VEDay stressing the need of international solidarity during the #COVID19 crisis

https://t.co/r1eVpvH24q https://t.co/QO07mo5hbk

https://t.co/xO3qFuWMkB

"As we combat this pandemic, we have a duty to protect people, end stigma and prevent violence."

-- @antonioguterres calls for global efforts to end hate speech amid the #COVID19 crisis. https://t.co/swmZgUCH5h https://t.co/FW0FhqIc60

40 years ago, smallpox was officially eradicated.
 
The lessons learned from that success can be used in the fight against #COVID19- including the importance of uniting the world behind science & the power of public health measures. https://t.co/sMNkexie51 https://t.co/iWIQw6COT6

🏠Staying home
💧👏Handwashing 
😇Being kind to each other

International tourism could fall up to 80% in 2020 due to #COVID19, putting millions of of jobs at risk. 

Despite global downturn, @UNWTO experts say tourism industry could start recovering by early 2021. https://t.co/HMMgNyZZRY https://t.co/XG5ikY62WB
Join us in honouring those who lost their lives during the Second World War during this week's time of remembrance. https://t.co/RuuMl2NuF2 #WWIII https://t.co/gdITWVHdoy

Smallpox is the first & only disease to be permanently eradicated worldwide.

40 years later, amid #COVID19, it is a reminder of how international health cooperation can achieve significant and lasting good. https://t.co/sMNkexie51 via @WHO https://t.co/X7yJSimnQB

After #WWII, the UN was established to save succeeding generations from the scourge of war. 

75 years on our work continues amid the #COVID19 pandemic and other global challenges. https://t.co/r1eVpvprcS https://t.co/L4LCpaeZyA

“The #COVID19 pandemic is hurting us all. But the most devastating and destabilizing effects will be felt in the world’s poorest countries." 

-- @UNReliefChief says $6.7 billion needed to help world's most vulnerable countries amid global health crisis.

https://t.co/76cdS0JL3y

It's normal to feel sad, lonely or overwhelmed during times of high stress, such as the #COVID19 pandemic. But physical distance does not have to mean social isolation.

May is #MentalHealthMonth. via @UN_Women https://t.co/NDB4kln2ZG

.@WFP and @UNICEF are working together to support children missing out on daily meals due to #COVID19 school closures. 

Ensuring health & nutrition services resume once schools reopen is also a top priority for the crisis response. https://t.co/ddh5GQhjFv https://t.co/Y95vDTbSgo

During Ramadan, @UNRWA is sending trucks door-to-door with food assistance in Gaza. 

More on their work to support Palestine refugees throughout the #COVID19 crisis. https://t.co/u2ajWh7aHx https://t.co/dFhmVAI2yi

The UN is working with & supporting artists to use their talents & diverse forms of cultural expression to foster solidarity in the face of #COVID19.

https://t.co/bOGnFd4Ejq

Lord Buddha’s timeless message of unity and service to others is more important than ever. It is only together that we will stop the spread of the #coronavirus and recover.
-@antonioguterres on #Vesak Day. https://t.co/klexxWJQ1m https://t.co/e4j2i9bgv3

For many women and girls, being home does not mean being safe. The #COVID19 crisis has created a surge in domestic violence around the world. 

Join @GlobalSpotlight and speak out against gender-based violence. https://t.co/wyLkEsQH72 https://t.co/npYeVOIYmT

"We must guarantee the equal rights of people with disabilities to access healthcare and lifesaving procedures during the pandemic."

-- @antonioguterres stressing the need to protect disabled people during the #COVID19 crisis. https://t.co/txF2ZZpF9v https://t.co/MjQRnxLx1C

The #COVID19 pandemic has revealed how inequalities affect countries' abilities to respond to shocks. 

New data from @UNDP highlights disparities when it comes to global preparedness & vulnerabilities. https://t.co/oH6PqpTLIk https://t.co/rSSDkqKxkz

"This crisis has already demonstrated that massive change can be brought about if there is political will & unity of purpose."

-- @AminaJMohammed hopes the #COVID19 recovery provides an opportunity to kick-start efforts to achieve the #GlobalGoals.  

https://t.co/3HNcTaxYQA

.@ITU & partners launch action plan to boost digital connectivity during #COVID19 pandemic.

Despite overstretched healthcare systems due to #COVID19, midwives continue to provide essential medical services to mothers & newborns.

On Tuesday's #DayoftheMidwife, join us in thanking them for their courage & commitment. https://t.co/LU4cGRjUG8 via @UNFPA https://t.co/rXhCXP5XhU

Over 80% of all maternal deaths, stillbirths & newborn deaths could be averted with qualified midwifery care.

On Tuesday's #DayoftheMidwife, see how midwives play a critical role in providing safe and effective care for women and newborns: https://t.co/58xtHRVvtQ https://t.co/aJOMs9Qk6f

Handwashing remains the most basic & important health measure to protect yourself against #COVID19 & many other diseases

On Tuesday's #HandHygiene Day, see how to make sure you have #SafeHands: https://t.co/dDzyDUcWTW

Despite the uncertainty amid #COVID19, midwives continue to provide an invaluable service to their communities.

On Tuesday's #DayoftheMidwife, @UNFPA calls for greater investments in midwifery to ensure access to maternal healthcare for all. https://t.co/LU4cGR2jhy https://t.co/QUBfe3OCkC

Tuesday is Portuguese Language Day.

Follow @NacoesUnidas to see our social media updates about #COVID19 & more in Portuguese. https://t.co/zzYaeEKkoT https://t.co/Cr0LuqxWcQ

Hand washing is one of the most effective ways to protect yourself & others from #COVID19, yet nearly 3 billion people lack soap & water at home.

On Tuesday's #HandHygiene Day - and every day - help mobilize action for access to hand hygiene for all: https://t.co/n8q1fHQ5aO https://t.co/YbROSnEvN4

From sharing vital health information about #COVID19 to providing children educational programmes following school closures, @UNPeacekeeping radio stations are supporting the pandemic response in some of the world's most vulnerable countries. (needs link)https://t.co/6HMQ5I9A9a

Congratulations to @UNESCO Guillermo Cano World #PressFreedom Prize laureate @jbedoyalima 
.

Now more than ever.
